main event: A bright, steady object was observed by two Air Force personnel over Guadalupe Pass, Texas, on October 8, 1954.
interesting points: The object was first sighted in the west, moving in a north-northeasterly direction.
When first observed, the object was approximately 30-40 degrees above the horizon and appeared to be traveling at a high rate of speed.
The object appeared to be approximately the size of a dime held at arm's length and had a bright, steady glow.
After traveling for approximately 10-15 seconds, the object suddenly accelerated and disappeared from sight in a northeasterly direction.
The military authorities conducted a local investigation, but no conclusion was reached.
